subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any tools for Test Case generation?
msgSnippet: JB misunderstood, Axis generates skeleton testcase, it is upto you to put asserts and values to test. Atleast it was useful in production environment where you
messageBody:
JB misunderstood,
Axis generates skeleton testcase, it is upto you to put asserts and
values to test. Atleast it was useful in production environment
where you donot have to write 1000 tests yourself .
"Much like corporate make or buy decision."


J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>Ranjeet Sahay wrote:
>
>
>>I would like to add there must be some tool to generate atleast skeleton
>>of testcases
>>
>>
>
>I have one: an Eclipse template. I type test, hit Ctrl+Space, and get this
>
>public void test|() throws Exception {
> fail("NYI");
>}
>
>The | is the cursor, so I can type the test name. "NYI" means "not yet
>implemented," so the test fails until I explicitly say it's ready to run.
>
>Beyond that I don't know what people would need.
>
>
>
>>To point Axis does generate JUnit TestCase skeleton for WebService testing.
>>
>>
>
>This is the kind of thing I don't trust. *I* know what tests I need to
>write; Axis shouldn't be telling me.
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
